# BEGIN: Some Like it Hot (Fuji's Arc)
DM [Ricochet] BOT 11-07-2024 23:06
An invitation arrives:
The pleasure of your company         is requested at     ~ MASQUERADE DU VOLCAN ~     at The Falinescu Estate   on the Sixth of Eyul at dusk Formal attire and masques requested
It is printed on luxurious scroll paper the color of a brilliant orange sunset, punctuated with gold leafing in delicate flames rising along the edges of the invitation. Curiously, it does not bear the name of the host of the engagement, and the messenger -- whether airborne, invisible, or nonexistent -- is nowhere to be found. A small insert in the invitation does contain a map leading north from the West Gate, pointing to a location at the foot of Mt. Baratok. No host. No occasion. Directions have been supplied. The only thing left is... what are you going to wear??
Georg BOT 11-07-2024 23:20
"Drake boy, look at what we got." Georg shows the scroll to Argont, dark feathery black hair jutting in every direction in the most bedhead of bedheads, climbing out of his tent that has been set up on a sturdy tree branch some 20 feet off the ground -- the way he prefers to sleep most nights. The drake rolls his eyes, signalling "you know I can't read that." Georg laughs and begins to don his clothes and armor. "I can't even read half of the words on this invite. Fa-lin-es-cu. Hm. Can't say I've heard of that family name before." He frowns. "But I haven't been to a party in so long... I think we gotta go. Come to market with me? I need to make myself something nicer looking if we have to go to a party!!" He exclaims. "Maybe I should get some barding for you, you stubborn boy..." And the ranger is off on Drake-back to town, for some breakfast and then a quick tour through the fabric stands at the open market...

Fritz (they/them) BOT 12-07-2024 01:20
Fritz leaves their new library librorum with Belnir's nose lost in a book as the invitation lands at their feet. Fritz frowns at the paper, despite having no brow to furrow or eyebrows to cross. It of course instantly reminds them of Fuji with the fanciful decoration, the fire theme and the whole idea of a masquerade... But what if it were a trap? If it was, they didn't want to risk Belnir nor this new haven and so they must prepare, just in case. It was only a day away so they needed to act sharpish. They know that they are a very identifiable figure, and it was one hard to hide regarding both sight and sound alike. They think, and think hard. They think of their first fights in Barovia. They think of their dinner with Strahd and the other guests present; who they were, what they wore. And, they think of Fuji. An idea comes, and Fritz sets to work. First they head into the woods to find and old tree with a thick branch which with a single swing of their maul and a loud crunch is dislocated from the trunk forever. Branch in arm, they head towards Barovia, to the forge which was usually quiet where they wouldn't disturb or be durturbed. They set to work with their woodcarver's tools, originally part of their programming to fix minor faults in their underarmour which was almost, but not quite entirely unlike wood... nonetheless the tools proved to be equal. Using the other things found in the forge it does not take them long with their expert craftmanbotship to be happy with their results and finish the item. Now, they needed help from good old Bethel, and so to Vallaki. They fly through the Barovia sky, conscious of their time away from Belnir and the clock ticking on Mind Blank and being hidden from Strahd. Flying high and hidden into Vallaki, they land out of sight and don their cunning disguise before heading into the shop for the specific items of clothing they thought would suit their needs. Fritz (they/them) BOT 12-07-2024 01:20
They are a little surprised when they see Stelinar in there, and then Rux, but they do not let on until their business is done and they disappear in a small puff of smoke as they pull their cloak around them. Seeking a place to go unnoticed, they put together their outfit with a few alterations here and there in an abandoned house full of cobwebs and fortunately no giant spiders. Here they rest, once all is done and accounted for as they watch the world go by through a window for their needed recharge time as their chaos within them churns. The day arrives as it always does in Barovia: with no sun, with no rooster, but with a settling mist and a cold breeze (now much less felt by Fritz). But Belnir's magic is about to fade, though Fritz is prepared, taking out Belnir's provided backup plan and casting Nondetection from a scroll inked by the scroll master himself. They unfurl it and this time, unlike the last time, at least notice it is the wrong way up. They flip it around and thi k, think to Belnir's teaching and are just about able to decifer the magic and cast the spell. Phew. Casting a quick Prestidigitation to rid their get up of any cobwebs it has accumulated from roaming spiders during their rest, they set off towards Mt. Baratok as the Raven flies. (edited)

Fuji BOT 12-07-2024 03:33
*Fuji studies the luxurious invitation with curiosity. No host named? Presumably, it must be Lord or Lady Falinescu, as implied by the estate name. Despite this slight lapse in formal etiquette, she decides to overlook it and bring a thoughtful gift ‚Äì a fancy cocktail elixir should suffice. Now, what to wear, what to wear... Formal attire is a must. Her new illusionary hat of disguise comes to mind, a perfect accessory for creating an enchanting ensemble. She envisions herself as a majestic Phoenix: a mask adorned with vibrant Phoenix feathers, a dress shimmering with illusory flames, a delicate wisp of perfume courtesy of Prestidigitation, and a faint melody of harp music courtesy of a minor illusion. Absolutely perfect. But how to get there without the tedium of walking? She ponders her options, considering the extravagant use of her magic to speed up the journey. Even for her, that seems a bit excessive. Perhaps she should invest in a flying carpet... With a dramatic sigh and a flip of her fiery dress, she sets off on foot, every step radiating magic.* (edited)

Stelinar BOT 12-07-2024 15:49
He paces about his room at the Blood on the Vine, his owl sitting nearby watching him with a cocked head "Entirely possible they meant it for someone else... that or it is a trap. When is something not a trap in this place?" Stelinar shakes his head, frustrated by this turn of events, doubts eating at him. He puts his hands on the table with the letter residing upon it, leaning against it "Know what? No, Hell no. Just this once, no, I don't have to do this to myself.‚Äù He nods, resolve firm on the matter as he goes to walk out the door to do literally anything else, before he stops, looking back at the letter, then at his owl Vigil "... I'm not the only one who got one... am I?" He takes off his cap, running a hand through his hair which was becoming more of a mess by the day "Okay, so I'm not the only one, that's a given. So what of it? They don't need me, if anything I slow them down!" He looks back over at his owl, his guardian, as if looking for some form of validation but just receives that same glare from those two sharp eyes He knew it wasn't true, and that frustrated him "Okay fine, I go, what the Hell would I wear? I'm a complete wreck!" He pinches the bridge of his nose, before taking off his detective coat and laying it out on his bed. He snaps his fingers as the shiftweave takes effect, transforming into the purple outfit he'd had made a few months back. Much to his own dismay, he had the tools even for this occasion. He'd even had this particular outfit enchanted, as he snaps his fingers once more and it becomes wreathed in the same flames that usually enshroud himself. "Fine... but I'm not going like this. If you're going to guilt me, you might as well be useful."
Stelinar BOT 12-07-2024 15:52
He pulls out a small hand mirror, a chair, and a pair of scissors as he hands off the mirror to the owl to carry. Performing a few gestures of his hand he conjures up a fiery mage hand which grips the scissors and begins cutting the absolute mess upon his head as Celeste had done so long ago. He'd go to her but there was little time. By the end of it, he was looking far more presentable. Then he remembers he needs a mask. He knew beings existed who could see through illusions, so it all had to be physical, true. He pulls out some of his tools and gets to work Before long he stands in front of the mirror being held by his owl, adorned in his outfit and mask with his firearm at his side. Oddly enough, despite being cursed and normally looking intimidating, it went quite well with what he was wearing. Thankfully the location wasn't far from where he was, so he decided to walk, grateful that his ring of water walking kept his boots clean and dry the entire trip. His owl flies overhead, keeping a watch over him as he places his cap in his bag of holding The cap and coat along with his vocation would have to be put away tonight. For the next few hours, he'd just be Stelinar Sel-Borne
‚≠ê 4
DM [Ricochet] BOT 12-07-2024 19:13
One by one, denizens from all over Barovia begin to arrive at the Falinescu Estate. It's not hard to find. In fact, it's hard to miss, and as each guest arrives, they wonder how they never knew this absolute feast for the eyes was here. Across the Ravenloft Moors and through to a clearing that must take an impressive amount of labor to keep manicured is a grand estate of three buildings arranged around a central entrance. The building is ancient and sturdy, made of dark stone that shimmers in the firelight. The grounds are decorated with thousands of candles and lanterns, and fire dancers wander the courtyard to entertain arrivals with displays of acrobatics and fire magic. And indeed, there is a literal red carpet decorated with ornate mirrors where guests can admire their outfits and surreptitiously gaze at the rest of the attendees before entering the manor itself. The effect gives a strange depth to the space, folding dimensions on themselves as guests mingle and explore.

"Strange, that we've never spotted an estate as grand as this during any of our flyovers of the valley, drake boy." *The rider leaps off of a fine leather saddle fastened upon the drake's back. A mop of messy black hair temporarily beaten into submission by the night air that must've been pushing it back for some time as he flew across Barovia to get here. Over a scale mail made of hundreds of dragon scales painstaking sewn together by hand, seemingly the same hue as the drake's scales, the newly arrived guest is wearing a long, green coat, decorated with embroidered spiraling silver motifs. On his face, the drakerider wears a wooden mask that covers his nose, eyes, and brow -- a mask that looks vaguely feline -- perhaps a tiger, jaguar, or lion.* "Oh, this party is much larger than I expected... not just a small dinner gathering like the two times I went to the castle..." And with that, he struts up to the entrance, drake in tow, across the red carpet.

Stelinar BOT 15-07-2024 21:36
A lot of people here, though this came of no surprise to him. He wasn't quite sure if he was up to snuff in this whole affair, but at least he knew he wasn't the only one outside of his comfort zone. There was Georg, then the rather larger individual that was wearing clothes somewhat suspiciously similar to what he'd spotted Fritz purchasing earlier in the store The one completely within her comfort zone however would be the recent arrival, Fuji. This came of little surprise to him as she was the most likely to show up to an event like this even uninvited, and not a soul would complain. He could attempt to keep his inquisitive nature at bay, but that isn't what has kept him alive so long. Questions ran through his mind: what was the point of this? Pure revelry? Unlikely, nothing in Barovia was ever quite so simple... nothing outside of Barovia was ever quite so simple when masks were involved. Why him? He doubted anyone present knew the true origin of his surname, and he never made claims of being anything higher than a simple detective. That just wasn't his nature. Why some of the others he has spotted so far? Fuji was a no brainer, the woman could possibly slip Castle Ravenloft out from under The Count himself if she truly set her mind to it. On the subject: Where was The Count in all of this? It really was the toss of a copper, on one hand Stelinar could figure a myriad of reasons for him not to show, but on the other he could also think of a myriad of reasons for him to be here full force. Sadly he had little to work with. As he always says, he is a detective, not a fortune teller. Best to go with the flow, and the flow right now lay with Fuji

Amorphous shapes can be seen moving in each of them, like visions through stained glass or gently swirling, crystalline waters. Shadows pass through the mirrors, mingling and moving in whatever imaginary realm the mirrors reveal. To the party's surprise, blindsight picks up this movement, albeit scattered and fractured. Anyone who wanders closer to inspect a mirror finds the shapes within solidifying the closer they get. But what secrets do they hold?
